meanings.definition: The belief that the universe and living organisms originate from specific acts of divine creation.
meanings.sent1: Creationism teaches that all life on Earth was created by a higher power.
meanings.sent2: Many people adhere to creationism as an explanation for the existence of living beings.
meanings.sent3: When discussing creationism, some may wonder if animals were also created in a day.
meanings.sent4: The concept of creationism can be seen as a beautiful tapestry woven by a divine artist.
meanings.sent5: In the debate between evolution and creationism, some find comfort in the idea of a creator.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that ascribes the origin of matter and all living things to God's creation.
meanings.sent1: Creationism asserts that everything in the universe is a result of divine creation.
meanings.sent2: The concept of creationism is deeply rooted in religious teachings.
meanings.sent3: Some may humorously suggest that creationism means God personally sculpted each animal.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, creationism can be likened to a masterful painting by a divine artist.
meanings.sent5: The idea of creationism paints a vivid picture of a world shaped by a higher power.
